p: The normal morphological characteristics such as triangular shape and soft surface of the cysts were observed in the control (Figures 8J-8L). It has been highlighted that the cysts treated with A. muricata (Figures 8A-8C) and C. trifoliatum (Figures 8D-8F) extracts demonstrated forms of retraction, compared with the control. Furthermore, folded cysts were observed when the cysts were treated with C. trifoliatum (Figures 8D-8F) and chlorhexidine (Figures 8G-8I). Additionally, the cell wall surface of shrink cysts treated with C. trifoliatum ( Figure 8F) was vaguely perturbed when compared with the control and chlorhexidine treated cells. The final concentration of DMSO presented in the extracts at 4×MIC was 2%. However, this concentration of DMSO did not affect the growth and morphology of A. triangularis as observed by trypan blue exclusion assay and inverted microscope (Fig. S1), respectively.
